abstract: Vodafone and HTC unveil a new touch-screen phone using Google’s Android software, but it is for only the European market for now.
snippet: Vodafone and HTC unveil a new touch-screen phone using Google’s Android software, but it is for only the European market for now.
lead_paragraph: Five months after T-Mobile introduced the first phone powered by Google’s Android operating system, the cellphone giant Vodafone is unveiling the second. Like its predecessor, the new device is made by a Taiwanese manufacturer, HTC. It is called the HTC Magic and has a touch screen, but not the slide-out keyboard that the T-Mobile G1 has.

headline.main: Vodafone and HTC Team Up on New Google Phone
